title: For the beginner
content:
Do any of you know of any good sites for typography tutorials, jargon etc etc?

My current typography skills are that if it is readable, then its ok which i’m sure isnt the right way of going about it!

Thanks
author: Advocation

comments.content: The Wiki’s a good place to start… [http://typophile.com/wiki/start](http://web.archive.org/web/20051031085726/http:/typophile.com/wiki/start)

Out of curiosity, if your typographic skills are “that if it is readable,  
then its ok” which/what are your calligraphic skills ?  
 [http://www.bilkent.edu.tr/~segalini/program/GRA211-T1.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20051031085726/http:/www.bilkent.edu.tr/~segalini/program/GRA211-T1.gif)

Good luck,  
AS

\> _if it is readable, then its ok_

Then hold the printed piece upside down towards a mirror and then look at it. Relax your eyes, gaze at a copy block and don’t even try to read it. See if you notice any areas that seem darker or lighter within the text block.

If you do, then the spacing is either too tight or too loose in that area. If you don’t, then either your spacing/kerning is fine, or need to continue training in typography… that is, if you’re still interested.
